newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia wins full Korean beef import tender.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia wins full Korean beef import tender.

text.p: Australia won the full South Korean government tender for 9,200 tonnes of beef, held August 16, the Australian Meat and Livestock Corp (AMLC) told Reuters.
Allister Lugsdin, the statutory authority's beef programme manager international, said Australia won the full tender in competition with New Zealand.
The tender comprised 4,000 tonnes of grassfed quarterbeef and 1,008 tonnes of grassfed fullsets.
Australia and New Zealand routinely compete for this part of the South Korean meat import market, but it was unusual for Australia to win the full tender, Lugsdin said.
Prices in the tender were up on previous tenders, he said.
The tender was held by the Korean government body, the Korean Livestock Products Marketing Organisation.
South Korea is Australia's third largest beef export market, after Japan and the U.S., taking 70,000 tonnes of Australian beef worth about A$210 million a year.

The tender win helped reverse a decline in Australia's market share in South Korea, from 44 percent in 1993 to 32.4 percent in 1994. to 31.0 percent in 1995 and to an estimated 27 percent in the present year.
Lugsdin said the win brought Australia's market share back to 30.3 percent.
The tender was the tenth for South Korea's 1996 quota year.
